Subject: Resource Fair
Object:
On the third Wednesday of every month from 10 am to 12 pm, we host a resource fair in partnership with Esperanza Health Center. Located at 3222 H Street, the resource fair offers food, clothing, and other resources. Appointments are not necessary. 

In addition, we have a community refrigerator outside located around the corner from 3234 Potter Street on Westmoreland with fresh food available. 

Individuals who are interested in receiving updates on our events can text “FOOD” to 866-551-1675 for updates and the latest information about events, timing, and changes, or follow us on Facebook, Instagram, or Twitter.

Subject: Farm to Families
Object: Each week, Farm to Families supplies North Philadelphia families with boxes of wholesome fresh produce or fruit at a reduced cost. Boxes are packed with delicious seasonal fruits and vegetables, often valued at double the price. Additional fresh items including local eggs, meat, and seafood are also offered at affordable prices.This program provides:- Food to meet basic nutritional needsFarm to Families also provides food and nutrition education, including food budgeting and shopping tips, basic food preparation and cooking skills, and demonstrations and taste tests, aligned with the weekly boxes.Orders are taken one week in advance. SNAP benefits are all accepted for payment. Farm to Families is open to all with no income restrictions.

Subject: My SISTAS Resource Hub
Object:
Mady's Hands provides a variety of services to assist individuals and families gain success and stability. This program offers support, direction, and success planning through free one-on one engagement.

Located at 1952 N 24th St, Philadelphia PA, 19121.

Our services will be available for walk-in only, no appointment needed.

 Monday: 1pm-5pm
Tuesday: 1pm-5pm
Wednesday: 1pm-5pm
Thursday: By Appt. Only

Our services include the following:

Food Pantry
Nursery Pantry including Diapers, clothing and other baby items.
HIV Testing Kits (Take Home)
Clothing Bank (availability varies-please call to see if we have your size, if not we have a referral for you)

See you soon!

Subject: Vivian's Cupboard Food Bank
Object: The Mazzoni Center provides the Vivian’s Cupboard Food Bank for low-income, HIV-positive Philadelphians who are facing food insecurity. The food bank aims to help clients and patients maintain optimal health and improve the efficacy of treatment regimens by providing them with a consistent, nutritious supply of food. This program provides:- Nutritious food The food bank allows clients to select packaged food items in a pantry-style setting. Clients are provided with additional resources such as information on other local/neighborhood food cupboards and information on accessing SNAP (food stamps).Referred individuals may access the food bank two times per month and receive the equivalent of four meals for each member of their household at each visit. Due to the COVID-19 pandemic, the Mazzoni Center has suspended the requirement that individuals need to be referred by a case manager or medical provider and have opened the food bank up to anyone in the community struggling with food insecurity.

Subject: Vivian's Cupboard Food Bank
